title: President of Chile - Wikipedia
snippet: The shorter term (previously it was six years) allows for synchronized parliamentary and presidential elections. The president's official seat is the La Moneda Palace in the capital Santiago. Michelle Bachelet was the first female president of Chile and served twice, from 2006 to 2010 and again ...

title: Chile elects far-right José Antonio Kast as next president
snippet: Kast beat the governing left-wing coalition candidate Jeanette Jara decisively with more than 58% of the vote in his third attempt at running for president. It marks the biggest shift to the right since the end of Chile's military dictatorship in 1990.

title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian

title: Kast’s Victory in Chile Is Another Win for Global Right-Wing Movement - The New York Times
snippet: José Antonio Kast, who was elected president on Sunday, is the latest conservative to rise to power promising strict law and order measures.
